t: Psalm 73
BOOK III
Psalms 73–89
A psalm of Asaph.
Surely*pn God is good to Israel, to*ld those who are pure in heart.
But*pn as for me, my feet had almost slipped; I*ld had nearly lost my foothold.
For*ln I envied the arrogant when*ld I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
They*pn have no struggles; their*ld bodies are healthy and strong.
They*ln are free from common human burdens; they*ld are not plagued by human ills.
Therefore*ln pride is their necklace; they*ld clothe themselves with violence.
From*ln their callous hearts comes iniquity; their*ld evil imaginations have no limits.
They*ln scoff, and speak with malice; with*ld arrogance they threaten oppression.
Their*ln mouths lay claim to heaven, and*ld their tongues take possession of the earth.
Therefore*ln their people turn to them and*ld drink up waters in abundance.
They*ln say, “How would God know? Does*ld the Most High know anything?”
This*pn is what the wicked are like— always*ld free of care, they go on amassing wealth.
Surely*pn in vain I have kept my heart pure and*ld have washed my hands in innocence.
All*ln day long I have been afflicted, and*ld every morning brings new punishments.
If*pn I had spoken out like that, I*ld would have betrayed your children.
When*ln I tried to understand all this, it*ld troubled me deeply
till*ln I entered the sanctuary of God; then*ld I understood their final destiny.
Surely*pn you place them on slippery ground; you*ld cast them down to ruin.
How*ln suddenly are they destroyed, completely*ld swept away by terrors!
They*ln are like a dream when one awakes; when*ld you arise, Lord, you*ld will despise them as fantasies.
When*pn my heart was grieved and*ld my spirit embittered,
I*ln was senseless and ignorant; I*ld was a brute beast before you.
Yet*pn I am always with you; you*ld hold me by my right hand.
You*ln guide me with your counsel, and*ld afterward you will take me into glory.
Whom*ln have I in heaven but you? And*ld earth has nothing I desire besides you.
My*ln flesh and my heart may fail, but*ld God is the strength of my heart and*ld my portion forever.
Those*pn who are far from you will perish; you*ld destroy all who are unfaithful to you.
But*ln as for me, it is good to be near God. I*ld have made the Sovereign Lord*s my refuge; I*ld will tell of all your deeds.
